column4: Im having trouble with mysql-server after an apt-get update. Eventually I got to a point where all the mysql packages will remove (so I can re-add them) except mysql-server. I keep getting this error: http://jindal.pastebin.ca/314367
do you know if the mysqld process is still running?
even after killing the processes (no mysqld when I "ps -A|grep mysql) it refuses to upgrade
I don't see anything about failing scripts though.. hm
sorry, I'm not sure what to suggest in that case. Perhaps a bug in the deb preinstall scripts?
yeah, I accept that its a but in the package, can I remove the package manaully somehow?
you can try 'dpkg' with a --force option
it's not something I've used often. Try 'dpkg --force-help' for more information
what happens if you just uninstall mysql-server? Same thing?
can you successfully run 'sudo /etc/init.d/mysqld start' and '/etc/init.d/mysqld stop'
hrm. not getting much via google for that error message
same, I google way before I ask =)
